intro: Psychotria tetrandra, commonly known as ayahuasca vine, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or greenish flowers. The plant contains various alkaloids, including DMT, which contributes to its psychoactive properties. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its cultural and spiritual significance, it is often cultivated in traditional settings for ceremonial use.
